description.narrative:
Emergency rescue, relief and disaster risk reduction and management are the areas of PRDS concern in order to deal with all emergencies in strategic and systematic manners as each plays its contributing role to reduce and minimize the impact of a disasters and emergencies while keeping the core values of humanity, impartiality and neutrality intact.
PRDS enter into formal Partnership with Oxfam Novib on 28 May 2013 after extensive Humanitarian Audit exercise conducted by the ON Team in 2012. PRDS Submitted a concept notefor humanitarian capacity building of its staff to Oxfam Novib which was approved and an agreement was signed in June 2013 having Core objective #To Enhance and strengthen the emergency response capacity of Participatory Rural Development Society (PRDS) staff foran effective and efficient humanitarian response#. As of September 30, 2013 PRDS has conducted one training on #Emergency need assessment# while Prepared detailed implementation plan for other training as well.
After assessing the performance and skill development of staff changes observed were, their Understanding about the key components of the training ,how to apply these skills in the field for rapid need assessment in emergency response situations. The same time the confidence level of the staff have increased with the basic clarity of the rapid need assessment tools and in relation to the nature of disaster.
Other side the training had also a clear impact on training participant during designing of Rapid need assessment preformat and delegation of tasks based on the expertise and other team organization.
By concluding the general impact of the first training, the change in organizational capacities is positive and by exercising tools and techniques the PRDS has conducted a successful and comprehensive Rapid need assessment inTirah Valley of Khyber Agency. This set of capacity building initiatives are directly contributing to the staff capacities and Organizational services deliverance, in Humanitarian response situations and ultimately helping to Identify and Support the vulnerable in all kind of emergencies.
From the last decade this known that KP/FATA and almost Pakistan is in emergency situation as of the Different reason, such as Militancy, sectarian violence, Terrorism and Natural disaster (Floods, Droughts, Earthquakes and others). In response to the devastating scenario in the country, the International humanitarian community have offered support in different sectors and having different Criterions of funds monitoring as well from Country By laws, such as NOCs, Security Issues etc
While to set the transparent humanitarian delivery mechanisms and to ensure the Donor guidelines, Streamlining of the organizational capacitieswas the need of the day. The capacity building initiatives funded by ONL is directly contributing to the circumstances, govt. laws and donor guideline to fight against the vulnerability in this disastrous situation
The results yielded after the first training conducted by PRDS on #Emergency Need Assessment# were enough good to develop the professionalism of our staff/employees to meet the highest standard. The Upcoming sectoral capacity trainings would contribute the sector wise specific capacity of the organization; ultimately the services of the organization in helping the vulnerable and marginalized communities of FATA and KP will be improved.

participating-org.narrative: Participatory Rural Development Society herein referred as (PRDS) is a non-profit, non-governmental and non-political Humanitarian Relief and Social Development Organization working to help all affected by Disasters, Emergencies and Conflicts and Povertyin Pakistan. The Organization was established in 2004 and registered under section 20 of Societies Registration Act, 1860. With a vision of ajust, prosperous and peaceful society based on principles of good governance, gender equality and fairness. Withamission To improvethe socio-economic conditions of poor and marginalized sections of society through sustainable livelihoods, conflict transformationand resilience building. THEMATIC AREAS: are# Emergency Response <(>&<)> Disaster Management# Nutrition andFood# Health# Agriculture# Shelter and Community Infrastructure# Water, Environment and Sanitation# Education CURRENT GEOGRAPHIC PRESENCE:Currently PRDS is working 04 Districts of KPK and 01 Agency of FATA.# District Charsada# District Kohistan# District Bannu# Bajaur Agency# District Peshawar

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security

description.narrative: no. of local organisations that have the capacity to provide quality humanitarian response according to international standards (sphere and code of conduct) when necessary and has improved its accountability towards the local people
